summary: IBV strain Beaudette is a respiratory pathogen of chickens that causes severe economic losses in the poultry industry worldwide. most IBV strains, amongst them virulent field isolates, can only be propagated in embryonated chicken eggs. the ability to introduce specific mutations holds promise for the development of rationally designed live-attenuated IBV vaccines and for studies into the biology of IBV in general. supplementary material The online version of this article contains supplementary material, which is available to authorized users. signal sequence at position 20,385 is highlighted in green. a spontaneous T to C silent substitution is highlighted in red.
